tweets.text: Nadejda came to the U.S. from Uzbekistan for love. She became a #NewUSCitizen in Kansas City & says it will open more doors with freedom & a good economy. She currently works in a medical center but hopes to become a nurse so she can better care for her husband. https://t.co/LRUP4uPvJK
#Congrats to the 29 married couples who celebrated #ValentinesDay by becoming #NewUSCitizens together at the @USCIS #Tampa office! https://t.co/RXpKBMQ2LD

Congratulations to #NewUSCitizen @BobsledKaillie on winning gold for the U.S. in the first ever women‚Äôs monbob! We are so proud to have been part of your citizenship journey that gave you the opportunity to represent @TeamUSA in the #WinterOlympics. https://t.co/eQKKkC9kdj

Sending some #GovLove to @USCISMediaWest! The team out west does an amazing job covering what‚Äôs happening in AK, CA, CNMI, Guam, HI, ID, MT, OR, & WA. Thanks for all that you do! https://t.co/k9dvdEExHI

Sending a big ‚ÄúHey y‚Äôall!‚Äù and lots of #GovLove to @USCISMediaSouth! The Southeast team keeps us all in the know about what‚Äôs happening in AL, AR, DC, FL, GA, LA, MD, MS, NC, PR, SC, TN, USVI & VA. Thanks for all that you do! https://t.co/KP96UuiRod

For the past 5 years, the @Jaguars have hosted a half-time naturalization ceremony where dozens of people have taken the Oath of Allegiance on the field to become #NewUSCitizens. The Jags won't be playing on #SuperBowl Sunday, but they're always the MVP to us! #DUUUVAL https://t.co/QbYGoRNfLO

Originally from Cuba, Zaily came to the U.S. in 2012 for a better life. After becoming a #NewUSCitizen last month in Omaha, Zaily knows she now has the better life she was looking for. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a dream come true. Now I feel even more part of this great country.‚Äù https://t.co/HtYUCzAtFH

The border patrol agents would ask me to assist in translating & help the children assimilate to their surroundings. I would partner them up with other children that might be able to be a friend throughout their journey in this new life experience.
I made it my daily task to ensure that these young moms had access to newborn clothing, powder milk, baby food, & toys. I believe I made a difference in the lives of these young children and moms.

The most heart wrenching experiences for me were seeing babies as young as 2 months old, coming in with their young mothers. As a mother myself of a young infant that I had back at home, I knew the struggles and support these young mothers needed.

A typical morning for me involved ensuring that the children knew where to access toiletry supplies, snacks, & change of clothing. I made sure throughout the day that the kids were able to watch movies in their pods, had games & coloring supplies, & I spent time talking to them.

I was detailed to Tucson, Arizona and stationed at a facility there to help support unaccompanied children. As a native Spanish speaker I had the advantage of being able to communicate and provide assistance to these young children who were typically between 5 & 16 years old. https://t.co/yAAJjz9KEA
Congratulations to @CursedChild cast member Lily Mojekwu, who plays Hermione in the San Francisco production. Today she took on her lifetime starring role as a #NewUSCitizen. https://t.co/L44y9IBSNz

Even that pales in comparison to the greatest reward ‚Äì reuniting separated families. I will never forget the embrace from one child I worked with when he was reunited with his parents, nor will I forget the parents who personally called to thank me for caring for their children.

There is no greater responsibility than taking care of children, especially someone else‚Äôs. One of the biggest highlights was helping a child who had dentures but no way to clean them or reattach them. I worked hard to get the proper supplies he needed so he could eat again.

Unaccompanied minors are the most vulnerable population arriving at the Southern Border. As a former teacher and Spanish speaking asylum officer, I had experience working with vulnerable populations and immediately volunteered to support our operations at the southwest border. https://t.co/GLlwhjBrWC
Today @USCIS announced a new mission statement - one that reflects the inclusive character of both our country and USCIS. (1/2) https://t.co/2FccEa9p3F

.@USCIS has a new mission statement! The U.S. is a welcoming nation that embraces people from across the world who seek family reunification, employment or professional opportunities & humanitarian protection. We want our mission statement to reflect these values. https://t.co/fgtjxFwE1w

In my pre-USCIS career I spent two decades working with organizations  to promote & advance the human rights of LGBTQI+ people worldwide. These experiences come in very handy in my day-to-day work when I consult with my colleagues on this issue or when I interview asylum seekers.

Being a gay man & immigrant I welcomed @POTUS' memorandum on advancing the human rights of LGBTQI+ persons around the world. Coming from Belarus, I know what it means to be attacked & beaten by community members or arrested & detained by the police solely for being who you are.

As I was expecting my 1st child, the Office of Refugee & Resettlement (ORR) needed help to expedite the placement for thousands of Unaccompanied Children (‚ÄúUC‚Äù). I couldn‚Äôt physically travel to the border while pregnant, but I was able to volunteer virtually. #EOAnniversary https://t.co/4G7ibfxnID

Additionally, USCIS will generally grant new & renewed EADs up to the end of the parole or deferred action period to applicants in the following categories:

- Paroled into the U.S. for urgent humanitarian reasons or significant public benefit
- Granted deferred action (non-DACA)

Last week I visited our Washington District Field Office, Potomac Service Center, and Arlington Asylum Office. I was briefed on the challenges and opportunities specific to the work they do to provide important services for millions of applicants who walk through our doors. https://t.co/Uqy6S44NPT

urls.title: Naturalization Eligibility Tool
urls.description: Official websites use .gov A.gov website belongs to an official government organization in the United States. Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock () or https:// means you've safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites. These questions are solely intended to help you determine whether you may be eligible to submit the Application for Naturalization (N-400). This tool does not determine if you are actually eligible for citizenship. After you submit

tweets.text: As communities around the world continue to celebrate #LunarNewYear, @USCIS encourages all eligible LPRs to apply for naturalization. Check your eligibility! https://t.co/00xy0Ae3nG

We continue to work with interagency partners to combat FGM/C and provide information about available resources to assist women and girls who have undergone or are at risk of FGM/C. We will continue to identify opportunities to #EndFGM in the United States and worldwide.

In advance of International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation, USCIS joins other U.S. government agencies and the international community in calling for an end to the practice of female genital mutilation or cutting (FGM/C). https://t.co/7lTFxS7xBP
#EndFGM

This #LunarNewYear, I reflect on my conversation with @SBTNOfficial. Ch√∫c m·ª´ng nƒÉm m·ªõi! Thank you for working with us to promote naturalization. Let us continue to spread the word about opportunities to apply for naturalization. https://t.co/cBMmpWJzP0

February marks the anniversary of @POTUS‚Äô executive orders aimed at restoring faith in the legal immigration system, promoting U.S. citizenship & strengthening integration & inclusion for new Americans. https://t.co/90UUdDLwPE

Thanks for joining my colleagues and I yesterday for our virtual briefing on the progress @USCIS has made in fulfilling @POTUS executive orders on immigration. It's an honor and a privilege to continue the work to build back better to ensure a more welcoming and inclusive nation. https://t.co/NcAY0X3aTw

#DYK the Groundhog day custom came to the U.S. with German immigrants? The weather-lore tradition was brought to Pennsylvania by German immigrants that settled there in the 18th & 19th centuries. Now each Feb. 2 we await Punxsutawney Phil‚Äôs forecast. What will it be this year? https://t.co/e0JGnJrv4E

The initial registration period for the fiscal year 2023 H-1B cap will run from 12pm ET on Mar. 1 to 12pm ET on Mar. 18. Prospective petitioners & representatives will be able to complete & submit their registrations using our online registration system. https://t.co/0OsUXKrd0X

‚ÄúHolocaust Remembrance Day is recognized one day each year. We know that remembrance is every day, as is the work that must accompany it.‚Äù  

A message from @SecMayorkas on #HolocaustRemembranceDay ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/fVatRgTXcG

On this International Holocaust Remembrance Day #WeRemember Stephan Ross, Holocaust survivor & founder of the New England Holocaust Memorial in Boston. On April 16, 2010, Ross was recognized by @USCIS as an Outstanding American by Choice. Read his story: https://t.co/jYbsS8KVmF https://t.co/RSwZIpqRhp
DHS is taking action to address the needs of our economy by making an additional 20,000 H-2B visas available to workers. https://t.co/MLJITBreKU

The supplemental H-2B visa allocation consists of 13,500 visas available only to returning workers who received an H-2B visa, or were otherwise granted H-2B status, during one of the last three fiscal years (FY 2019, 2020, or 2021).
These additional H-2B visas will be set aside for U.S. employers seeking to employ additional workers on or before March 31, 2022.

.@DHSgov & @USDOL have published a joint temporary final rule making an additional 20,000 H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas available for fiscal year 2022. Learn more:  
https://t.co/95NyCyslaj

On Holocaust Remembrance Day, USCIS remembers the victims of the Holocaust & those targeted by the Nazi regime. Following World War II, the U.S. created new immigration policies to allow people displaced by the war in Europe to enter the U.S. and obtain permanent residency.

Global #STEM talent is critical for U.S. competitiveness, innovation, & economic growth. That‚Äôs why today @DHSgov @USCIS & @StateDept announced 4 new ways the Biden-Harris administration is welcoming int‚Äôl students, STEM researchers, & entrepreneurs: (1/6)
https://t.co/7U4aiZt0U9

It was an exciting day for @JourneyMuseum as they hosted their first-ever naturalization ceremony on Jan. 11. Helping to welcome 12 #NewUSCitizens from 11 countries added to the richness of the American history, Black Hills history & Native American culture taught at the museum. https://t.co/QdozjqRCtH
Since Jan. 3, USCIS has assisted more than 150 people affected by the #MarshallFire in the replacement process and will continue to support all who may need our help. https://t.co/zYcHDC7FP7

On Dec. 30, 2021, Boulder County suffered from the most destructive wildfire in Colorado history. Many lost important immigration & citizenship documents due to the fire. USCIS quickly took action to provide those impacted with as much information & critical services as possible. https://t.co/zhYRzckuk4

What do you do when you're from Brazil and love the @USNavy, America, and football? You become a sailor and later a #NewUSCitizen during a @Jaguars game of course! "It's a dream come true!" said Marcelo, a former high school football player. Congrats and thanks for your service! https://t.co/piVcnbM6mQ

urls.title: Joint Letter on Public Charge | Food and Nutrition Service
urls.description: The .gov means it‚Äôs official. Federal government websites often end in .gov or .mil. Before sharing sensitive information, make sure you‚Äôre on a federal government site. The site is secure. The https:// ensures that you are connecting to the official website and that any information you provide is encrypted and transmitted securely. Dear State SNAP Commissioners and Community Partners, The Food and Nutrition Service (FNS) of the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) and the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration

tweets.text: Today we issued a joint letter with @USCIS to communicate #publiccharge policy about SNAP. FNS is committed to ensuring eligible families can access nutrition benefits. Learn more: https://t.co/w1sc2JuMmo

Congratulations to the 29 #NewUSCitizens who were sworn in at a special Boston naturalization ceremony held in honor of #MLKDay. @DHSgov Assistant Secretary for Partnership and Engagement Eva Millona was among the first to congratulate the new Americans! https://t.co/5ah4HlIuiG

Robyn and Andrew are a married couple from the U.K.  They became #NewUSCitizens at the @Jaguars game halftime. Robyn said after coming off the field in front of thousands: "I was emotional because I feel so privileged and moved to be an American!" We can imagine. Congrats! https://t.co/qG0T4DtySg

On National Human Trafficking Awareness Day - and every day - the @USCIS leadership team stands in solidarity with victims and survivors. We are committed to protecting and supporting them as @DHSgov works to end human trafficking. #WearBlueDay https://t.co/Mxon0zWcst
WOW @Jaguars pulled off the upset against @Colts!! Congratulations! And thank you for hosting the fourth naturalization ceremony at an @NFL game. Well played! #DUUUVAL https://t.co/ag8smhTXnH

What better way to start 2022 than by becoming a #NewUSCitizen at an @NFL game in front of thousands of your neighbors? That's what happened for 72 people during halftime of the exciting @Jaguars and @Colts game! Congrats! https://t.co/KpvEo7APu0

Congratulations to these 72 people from 31 countries who just took the Oath of Allegiance to the United States, becoming the newest Americans at the @Jaguars vs. @Colts game. Seems right to call it America's game! #NewUSCitizens #DUUUVAL https://t.co/6zQRJyzAZ2
In honor of #NationalTriviaDay, here is some citizenship trivia for you. What answer best describes the promise(s) you make when you become a #NewUSCitizen?

Expedited processing means only that USCIS will process the application faster. 
To determine whether you are a qualifying healthcare worker, see pages 7-9 of this @CISAgov resource: https://t.co/rUUW9kGDmr

Be prepared to provide proof of profession or current employment. If the information or evidence you provide is insufficient, we may deny your expedite request without requesting additional evidence from you.

urls.title: How to Make an Expedite Request
urls.description: ALERT:¬†If you are a healthcare worker or a childcare worker

tweets.text: ATTENTION healthcare workers: If you have a pending renewal for an Employment Authorization Document (EAD) that expires in 30 days or has expired, please call the USCIS Contact Center at 800-375-5283 (TTY 800-767-1833) to request an expedite. Learn more: https://t.co/ljeQHKT2T7

What a way to celebrate the season with your family: these parents and their three adult children took the Oath of Allegiance together at our Fort Myers, Florida office. Originally from Russia, they are now #NewUSCitizens and can toast 2022 as the newest American family! https://t.co/bRX1odnqhx

Zhihua came to the U.S. from China for freedom and safety. He owns a motel in Cody, Wyo., and became a #NewUSCitizen Dec. 14. For Christmas he‚Äôs traveling to be with family in Texas and friends in Florida. His #NewYearsResolution is to make his children happy. https://t.co/fETv5hTnru

Rashmi came to the U.S. from Nepal seven years ago for dental hygiene school and likes the independence in the U.S. She became a #NewUSCitizen in Denver. She‚Äôs looking forward to Christmas dinner, since her brother-in-law does the cooking, and he tries a new recipe each year. https://t.co/C7hxNIZOxz
#FormI9: @DHSgov announced an extension of Form I-9 flexibilities until April 30. Learn more here: https://t.co/3DrSdCbYj0

Tony and Johnny do a lot together as twins. They even became #NewUSCitizens together in Denver. They live in Lakewood, Colo., and are attending @RRCCedu. They‚Äôre looking forward to a traditional U.S. Christmas and eating goat their mom will cook for New Year‚Äôs. https://t.co/VYkrcNRGd8

Renuka arrived to her #NewUSCitizen ceremony in Denver wearing a dress from her native country of India. She came to the U.S. 23 years ago to take care of family. Her #NewYearsResolution is to start hiking and volunteering to fix trails again. ‚ÄúI love volunteering.‚Äù https://t.co/yxRxGa7u2Z

The supplemental H-2B visa allocation consists of 13,500 visas available only to returning workers who received an H-2B visa, or were otherwise granted H-2B status, during one of the last three fiscal years (FY 2019, 2020, or 2021).
These additional H-2B visas will be set aside for U.S. employers seeking to employ additional workers on or before March 31, 2022.

tweets.text: Today is the deadline for eligible Liberian nationals and their family members to apply for permanent residency through #LRIF. If you are eligible and haven‚Äôt already, I urge you to submit a properly filed application as soon as possible! https://t.co/GLOgUGPI1I

On #InternationalMigrantsDay we honor the resounding spirit and determination of migrants who seek opportunity to thrive for themselves & their loved ones. @USCIS stands with @StateDept & @DHSgov to reaffirm its commitment to safe, orderly, and humane migration around the world.

That moment when you become a #NewUSCitizen, you do a little happy dance! Congrats to Eliana from Colombia who took the Oath of Allegiance and became an American with 9 others in #Orlando. https://t.co/FQ4OTQc51R

Kler, Sho, Po and Bel, sisters and refugees from Burma, wore big smiles and dresses made in their country of origin, as they became #NewUSCitizens Friday in Lincoln, Neb., at the courthouse on Human Rights Day. Sho said, ‚ÄúI can stand up, because I know I am free in this land.‚Äù https://t.co/Rr0iRGDXpc

We are very close to the deadline for #LRIF. For those who may be eligible for permanent residency through this program, please remember to submit a properly filed application by Dec 20th. For more information, visit: https://t.co/Mdzh1ZWQzU

urls.title: Lock
urls.description: Combating human trafficking is a top priority for the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Biden-Harris Administration. Today, the White House released an updated National Action Plan to Combat Human Trafficking, which focuses on four key U.S. and global anti-trafficking efforts: prevention, protection, prosecution, and partnerships. DHS, a leader in the fight against human trafficking, helped develop the White House whole-of-government National Action Plan to Combat Human Trafficking.

tweets.text: Last week, the @WhiteHouse National Action Plan to Combat Human Trafficking was released. @DHSgov works every day to combat this terrible crime and #EndTrafficking https://t.co/B0OyJeDZ5M
While in Phoenix, @SecMayorkas had a chance to thank our local @USCIS team for all of their hard work. #WeAreDHS https://t.co/WG3SeUXdxy

Today we honor @USNavy Chief Watertender and naturalized citizen Peter Tomich, awarded the Medal of Honor for sacrificing his life to save others during the attack on #PearlHarbor, 80 years ago today. #PearlHarborRemembranceDay https://t.co/gzJnHyQyDe

Today marks the 80th anniversary of #PearlHarbor, an event that brought the U.S. into WWII. Scholars estimate more than 300k immigrants served in the U.S. armed forces during WWII with more than 100k of them becoming #NewUSCitizens, like @USArmy Sgt. Charles A. MacGillivary. https://t.co/6aTnwigXCl

During a special ceremony in honor of the USCIS Asylum Corps‚Äô 30th anniversary, @USCISDirector Jaddou presented Otto Padr√≥n, president & CEO of Meruelo Media, with the Outstanding Americans by Choice award, recognizing his outstanding achievements as a naturalized U.S. citizen. https://t.co/6PMFEZVwR5

Great to be back in my home state of CA to meet with stakeholders in our LA office for my first west coast engagement. It‚Äôs so important to engage & to hear from all those we serve. @USCIS will continue to listen to our communities and provide meaningful opportunities to engage. https://t.co/OebnJIz5sq

Tony Faumuina is a @USCIS St. Paul support specialist & now officially a #NewUSCitizen! Originally from American Samoa, Tony's parents encouraged him to get his education in the U.S. for a better life. Tony served 14 years in the @USAirForce Reserve & worked @CBP & @DeptofDefense https://t.co/Nqdlf9lFqL

Congratulations to Dindsdale Compton, originally from England on becoming a #NewUSCitizen at our Albuquerque Field Office last week! At 91 years young, he shared, ‚ÄúI am deeply grateful to the U.S. for the opportunities it has given me and my family.‚Äù https://t.co/Kswp9V995g

urls.description: ALERT: On Oct. 29, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Servic

tweets.text: REMINDER: The deadline for #LRIF is fast approaching. I urge any applicant who may be eligible for permanent residency through LRIF to submit a properly filed application by Dec 20th. https://t.co/GLOgUGPI1I

urls.title: USCIS Temporarily Extending Validity Period of Form I-693
urls.description: Beginning Aug.¬†12, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration¬†Services¬†is temporarily extending the validity period for¬†Form I-693, Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record,¬†from¬†two¬†years to now¬†four¬†years¬†due to COVID-19-related delays in¬†processing.

tweets.text: If you are applying for an employment-based Green Card, and we sent you a Request for Evidence (RFE) for your Form I-693, please respond as soon as possible so we can finalize a decision on your adjustment application. Learn more https://t.co/kHzzzL3OGL https://t.co/Te66U8DoIr

Filing online offers a convenient and secure way to submit and track the status of your application. TPS applicants may now file Forms I-765 and I-821 online to receive their Employment Authorization Document more promptly.

Online filing for Form I-821 is now available for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) first-time registrants and re-registrants. It‚Äôs our priority to make forms more accessible and increase the number of forms available for online filing. Learn more: https://t.co/VyKVT4Gyvc

158 years ago yesterday, President Lincoln gave his Gettysburg Address during the dedication of the Soldiers‚Äô National Cemetery. @USCIS was honored to be part of @GettysburgNMP Dedication Day & welcomes 15 #NewUSCitizens sworn-in as new Americans. Congratulations to all! https://t.co/gVBosGuMYv

USCIS is taking steps to identify affected applicants and expects to issue refunds by March 22, 2022. If you believe USCIS accepted your fee in error, please visit the webpages for Form I-765 and Form I-918 for additional information and instructions

USCIS may have mistakenly rejected bona-fide-determination-related Forms I-765 submitted without a fee or fee waiver from June 14 through Sept. 29, 2021. We may have accepted other applications with an unnecessary fee.

USCIS implemented a bona fide determination process for certain U nonimmigrant status principal petitioners & qualifying family members, living in the U.S., to receive employment authorization & deferred action. Under this policy, there's no fee for an initial Form I-765.

USCIS has adjudicated work authorization applications for more than 61,000 Afghan evacuees. #OperationAlliesWelcome is also providing career services to help Afghans find jobs and match them with potential employers to help them start their next chapter. #AlliesWelcomeChat https://t.co/cgMXPL94Dx

USCIS recently determined the need to select additional registrations to reach the fiscal year (FY)  
2022 H-1B numerical allocations (H-1B cap). On Nov. 19, we selected previously submitted electronic registrations using a random selection process.

If you are applying for an employment-based Green Card, and we sent you a Request for Evidence (RFE) for your Form I-693, please respond as soon as possible so we can finalize a decision on your adjustment application. Learn more: https://t.co/TCAfAfEPIv https://t.co/GYTL57Ef19

With the deadline for #LRIF fast approaching on Dec 20th, @USCIS encourages any applicant who may be eligible to apply by submitting a properly filed application ASAP! For more information, and to sign up for our Nov 17th webinar visit: https://t.co/RAjonFaaDG

On #VeteransDay we celebrate all who have devoted their lives for our country. Since 2002, @USCIS is proud to have naturalized more than 148,000 members of the U.S. military around the world. Their dedication enriches our nation and we are committed to support them every day. https://t.co/QIEhpDPQAt
Watch live as @USCISDirector and @SecVetAffairs help welcome 12 veterans as #NewUSCitizens during a special #VeteransDay themed naturalization ceremony.  https://t.co/mBK9yX6i58

Afghan nationals paroled into the U.S. on or after July 30, 2021, due to the humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan will be exempt from filing fees and USCIS will streamline their application processing. https://t.co/VDO8oL4mLS

We're committed to providing immigration resources to #ServiceMembers & their families. In honor of #VeteransDay we'll hold more than 90 Veterans Day-themed ceremonies to celebrate & welcome more than 4,400 #NewUSCitizens ‚Äì including veterans. https://t.co/GPDxvWWxRM

If an applicant cannot provide primary evidence of Liberian nationality, they must demonstrate this. The best way to do this is to submit a written & signed statement that explains attempts to acquire primary evidence and includes records demonstrating these attempts.

We‚Äôve expanded Policy Manual guidance for Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness (LRIF) to clarify what applicants must do if they cannot submit primary evidence of Liberian nationality. Learn more: https://t.co/UWyJfXtpsH

NYC is known as a city of immigrants. It was literally built by immigrants - the Brooklyn Bridge was designed by German immigrant John Augustus Roebling & built by a crew comprised mostly of Irish immigrants - and now, 40% of NYC residents are foreign-born. #NationalImmigrantsDay https://t.co/8YT2btPaDu

On #NationalImmigrantsDay, I reflect on my family‚Äôs story & the stories of so many immigrant families who came to this country seeking the American dream.

Immigrants are an integral part of the fabric of our nation & we take pride in their many contributions to our communities.

L.A. is a city of belonging and home to over 1.5 million immigrants.

I was proud to participate in the @USCIS Children's Naturalization Ceremony hosted by @LAPublicLibrary to congratulate 26 children on becoming U.S. citizens!

We are happy that you call L.A. home. https://t.co/F6RAPqjZg0

Markus from Sweden was one of 25 people who became a #NewUSCitizen in Orlando. As he gazed at his new country's flag, he had this to say: "I've been here 10 years. This is where I met my wife. This is where I live and work. This is home." Congrats to all and welcome home Markus! https://t.co/d7a423WjTZ

urls.title: Abused Spouses, Children and Parents
urls.description: The family-based immigration process generally requires U.S. citizens and lawful permanent residents to file a petition for their noncitizen family members. Some petitioners may misuse the immigrat

tweets.text: This National Domestic Violence Awareness and Prevention Month, we honor the remarkable resilience of survivors. @USCIS offers immigration benefits that provide a path to safety for individuals who have experienced domestic violence. https://t.co/dJf2rmGodN
The @ChicagoBotanic was a beautiful venue for Chief District Court Judge Rebecca R. Pallmeyer to help @USCIS welcome 35 #NewUSCitizens from 16 nations. Congratulations! https://t.co/LT3oaHLxIl

24 people from 16 countries became #newUScitizens in Orlando, including Milkema from Panama. This busy mom of three planned to celebrate by going out to eat American foods with her family: hamburgers and BBQ ribs! Congrats and what time should we be there Milkema? https://t.co/IaiC9VBX7j

DHS is announcing new efforts as part of our #DHSmission to #EndTrafficking. 

‚úÖ@SecMayorkas directed DHS to take a victim-centered approach in all policies, programs & activities that impact engagement w/crime victims.  

https://t.co/w0eqDNnCSY https://t.co/Pl8f7nj9QH

Today, DHS marks the first anniversary of our Center for Countering Human Trafficking‚Äîa Department-wide effort led by @ICEgov that works to #EndTrafficking, protect victims of sex trafficking and forced labor, and prevent these terrible crimes. https://t.co/ZAlxiAhvJ1 https://t.co/S0qeHlNWDs

A T visa enables certain victims of human trafficking to remain in the U.S. for up to 4 years if they have assisted law enforcement in the detection, investigation or prosecution of human trafficking or qualify for an exemption or exception & meet other eligibility requirements.

We remain committed to supporting @DHSgov‚Äôs fight against human trafficking & have issued updated guidance on adjudicating applications for T nonimmigrant status (T visas) from victims of human trafficking, including eligibility requirements. Learn more: https://t.co/ybeKD07Bck

annotations.normalized_text: Filipino World War II Veterans Parole

tweets.text: ICYMI: @USCIS will continue the Filipino World War II Veterans Parole (FWVP) program to help Filipino veterans and their families through safe, legal, and orderly channels of migration to the United States. For more information visit: https://t.co/IgvMqb0Yvw

#Employers who knowingly violate or circumvent the Form I-9 process may be subject to civil and/or criminal penalties. Join us on Oct. 27 for a Form I-9 overview webinar & you'll also earn professional development credits through @SHRM & @HRCI_Official
https://t.co/w8tJXrO6m2

I'm honored to be the first Mexican American woman to lead @USCIS - the agency that naturalized my parents. This #HispanicHeritageMonth, we celebrate C√©sar Ch√°vez, Sonia Sotomayor, and those most dear to us whose shoulders we stand on. ¬°Adelante! https://t.co/oREEbDbxpO

This October, @USCIS joins in commemorating #FilipinoHeritageMonth and uplifting the culture and contributions of our Filipino American brothers and sisters ‚Äì 48,100 of whom became New Americans in FY-2021. Happy Filipino Heritage Month!

#HRCommunity: Don‚Äôt miss the FREE E-Verify Overview webinar eligible for PDC through @SHRM and @HRCI_Official this Wednesday, Oct. 13, at 2 pm ET. Spots are filling quickly. Register now!  https://t.co/w8tJXrO6m2

America‚Äôs immigrants are creators, innovators, and groundbreakers whose achievements reach heights as high as the Nobel Prize. These incredible individuals remind us that America remains a country of possibilities. https://t.co/lms81Z3c1q

Welcoming new Americans is a cornerstone of the @USCIS mission and a priority for the Biden-Harris Administration‚Äôs effort to promote naturalization and integration for New Americans. To learn more about our efforts, please visit: https://t.co/mxyeoZr2CG https://t.co/e5AZkzrVAA
Thank you @SecondGentleman and @DetroitPistons for joining @USCIS in welcoming 17 new Americans at a special naturalization ceremony to celebrate #HispanicHeritageMonth. https://t.co/gZOpWQjhzX
This is what customer service is all about! Thank you Joe for going above and beyond. #CustomerServiceWeek https://t.co/UwuBdR4jee

Last night, at the @DetroitPistons halftime, I had the honor of welcoming 17 new American citizens at a special #HispanicHeritageMonth naturalization ceremony. Congratulations! https://t.co/74Mbpr13UM

We're gearing up for a special #HispanicHeritageMonth naturalization ceremony during tonight's @DetroitPistons halftime show. The @SecondGentleman & @USDCMIED will join us in welcoming 17 #NewUSCitizens! We can't wait for these new Americans to slam dunk into citizenship. https://t.co/HwHY9lQIrS

I was honored to join the @NIICNewAmerican conference to share critical updates from @USCIS. Naturalization and immigrant integration are cornerstones of our agency‚Äôs mission ‚Äì and we are committed to fulfilling our promises to New Americans. #BuildBackBetter #NIIC2021 https://t.co/Lgj1qM6qzf

Today we kick off National Customer Service Week with the theme ‚ÄúCelebrating the Heart of Service.‚Äù @USCIS remains committed to providing outstanding customer service to everyone during their immigration journey.

urls.title: International Entrepreneur Parole
urls.description: Official websites use .gov A.gov website belongs to an official government organization in the United States. Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock () or https:// means you've safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites. Under this final rule, entrepreneurs granted parole will be eligible to work only for their start-up business. The spouses and children of the foreign entrepreneur may also be eligible for parole. While spouses may apply for work

tweets.text: ICYMI: If you‚Äôd like to learn more about the International Entrepreneur Parole (IEP) program and how to apply, check out our Q&A page that further explains how this program can provide an opportunity for our next generation of startup leaders. https://t.co/RkjB454jAD
It was nothing but sunny skies and ocean breezes for 14 people from 7 countries who became #NewUSCitizens today @CHISNPS. Congrats to all! #FindYourPark https://t.co/RsWlGQqgNo

114 years ago this month, a ship full of ‚Äú1000 Marriageable Girls‚Äù arrived at Ellis Island. Given that name by reporters, the women‚Äôs story appeared in newspapers across the country. Men even wrote letters to the Immigration Service asking to be matched with eligible women.

Today, DHS and @USCIS awarded nearly $10 million in grants to 40 organizations in 25 states to help prepare lawful permanent residents (LPRs) for naturalization.   

Read more https://t.co/tir5nqx9nr

Getting an early start to #ConstitutionWeek, 40 people became #NewUSCitizens yesterday at Colorado National Monument. The bright blue skies added to the array of red, white and blue flags and attire. Thanks to @NatlParkService for hosting the ceremony. Congrats to all! https://t.co/wp95MEHRYg

Today I was so humbled to welcome 39 new citizens to the American family. As a daughter of two immigrants ‚Äì with a father from Iraq and a mother from Mexico ‚Äì this moment was so special to me. Congratulations to you all on becoming American citizens! https://t.co/McztSvQq8q

It is an honor to welcome our newest Americans on Citizenship Day and Constitution Day. Today is a special day at @USCIS ‚Äì an agency where so many people come to work every day to help those at home and abroad realize the full meaning of U.S. citizenship.
To kick off #ConstitutionWeek @DHSgov Sec. Alejandro Mayorkas welcomed 200 #NewUSCitizens from 46 countries at NYC‚Äôs iconic @LincolnCenter today in honor of #CitizenshipDay. https://t.co/wyixxe8LJ0

Congratulations to these 40 #NewUSCitizens who were sworn in today during a special naturalization ceremony in Boston to celebrate #CitizenshipDay and recognize Outstanding American By Choice Judge Rya W. Zobel. https://t.co/qpU9f7qIo8

Immigrants come to America from different circumstances, but every generation has made us stronger. This Citizenship Day serves as a reminder that it‚Äôs up to us to ensure we remain a country worthy of the dreams and aspirations of immigrants from around the world. https://t.co/1jBBqLBUop

Today, in honor of the 20th anniversary of 9/11, @USCIS lowered our nation‚Äôs flag to half-staff & observed a moment of silence in memory of the thousands who lost their lives. We will never forget all those who chose to serve the cause of freedom at home & abroad. #DHSRemembers https://t.co/Sgd3yLbtUP

.@DHSGov is automatically extending the validity of TPS-related documentation for beneficiaries under the TPS designations for El Salvador, Haiti, Honduras, Nepal, Nicaragua & Sudan for 15 months through Dec. 31, 2022, from the current expiration date of Oct. 4, 2021.
Beneficiaries under the TPS designation for Haiti will retain their TPS while either of the preliminary injunctions in Ramos or Saget remains in effect.

Beneficiaries under the Temporary Protected Status (TPS) designations for El Salvador, Honduras, Nepal, Nicaragua and Sudan will retain their TPS while the preliminary injunction in Ramos & the Bhattarai orders remain in effect, provided that their TPS is not withdrawn.

.@DHSgov has published a notice in the Federal Register to announce its continued compliance with the preliminary injunction orders in Ramos et al. v. Nielsen et al.; Saget et al. v. Trump et al.; and in Bhattarai v. Nielsen. https://t.co/NGuL5oKhQq

Happy #LaborDay to America‚Äôs workforce, including the heroic workers @USCIS. Today, we honor you and those who advocate for safer standards at work. As Director, I am committed to building a strong relationship with labor leaders as we build a better and brighter future for all.

urls.title: Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record
urls.description: If you are applying for adjustment status to become a lawful permanent resident, use this form to establish that you are not inadmissible to the United States on public health grounds.

tweets.text: #FilingTipFriday: Save time ‚Äì file together! Filing form I-485 & Form I-693 together eliminates the need for us to issue a Request for Evidence (RFE) to obtain your Form I-693 & helps avoid adjudication delays. Learn more: https://t.co/Vgkczwhzfc
(1/2) @uscis offers a variety of resources and tools for victims, #LawEnforcement, and #Advocates regarding victim protections. https://t.co/zkj0z8kWAk

In honor of #WomenEqualityDay, we celebrate women in federal immigration & citizenship history. In 1971, Marjorie Jackson became the highest-ranking African American woman in @TheJusticeDept & the highest-ranking woman in the Immigration & Naturalization Service.

Obtaining a #Tvisa or #Uvisa doesn't mean an individual will automatically receive permanent U.S. residence. Instead, individuals granted a T or U visa may be eligible to apply for a green card if they meet certain requirements.  

Learn more from @uscis: https://t.co/fTpPdU0KRL https://t.co/Fudr6iF98P

tweets.text: If you are applying for an employment-based Green Card and we sent you a Request for Evidence (RFE) for your Form I-693, please respond as soon as possible so we can finalize a decision on your adjustment application. Learn more https://t.co/kHzzzL3OGL https://t.co/saAnBWMwZk
#LawEnforcement officials play an important role in the #Tvisa and #Uvisa process. U visa petitions require submission of a law enforcement certification with info about the victim‚Äôs helpfulness.

Myth: A noncitizen victim should only apply for one visa or immigration benefit at a time.  

Fact: A noncitizen victim may qualify for both the #Tvisa and #Uvisa, or other humanitarian protections. https://t.co/33H6eJMYXw

urls.title: Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record
urls.description: If you are applying for adjustment status to become a lawful permanent resident, use this form to establish that you are not inadmissible to the United States on public health grounds.

tweets.text: #FilingTipFriday: Save time ‚Äì file together! We encourage you to file Form I-485 & Form I-693 together. Filing at the same time eliminates the need for us to issue a Request for Evidence (RFE) to obtain your Form I-693 & helps avoid adjudication delays. https://t.co/1qroChPXPy https://t.co/by6gWjnYl7

USCIS stopped applying the 2019 public charge rule this year - but there is still much to do to overcome confusion & fear. Today, we launched a resource page to inform communities about the 1999 policy guidance that is currently in effect. Check it out ‚û°
https://t.co/510dHIsGZ8

As of Aug. 13, we‚Äôve received enough petitions to reach the additional 22,000 H-2B visas made available under the FY 2021 H-2B supplemental visa temporary final rule. Learn more https://t.co/UNfKshlFoo

The #Tvisa and #Uvisa are humanitarian protections intended to support noncitizen victims of #HumanTrafficking and other serious crimes and facilitate investigations. But there are different eligibility factors for each.  

Learn more from @uscis: https://t.co/G1hbO6ZJhS https://t.co/GtFM4GbGlA

U nonimmigrant status (#Uvisa) provides immigration protection to noncitizen crime victims who have suffered substantial mental or physical abuse as a result of a qualifying crime. https://t.co/1087yqei6n
The proposed change is designed to improve the ability of the U.S. asylum system to efficiently handle the rising number of protection claims and reduce processing times.

.@DHSgov & @TheJusticeDept published a notice of proposed rulemaking that would allow USCIS asylum officers to fully adjudicate applications for asylum, withholding of removal, and CAT protection for individuals who receive a positive credible fear determination.
Today, DHS and @TheJusticeDept are publishing a notice of proposed rulemaking to make the asylum process more efficient and ensure fairness.  https://t.co/HNsLDNLwZg

T visas allow certain eligible victims of #HumanTrafficking to remain in the U.S. if they have assisted law enforcement in an investigation or prosecution of human trafficking or qualify for an exception. 

Learn more from @uscis: https://t.co/2u5FveugZr https://t.co/j5kmMJHFGT
